result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Preclude Presumption of Automatic Admissibility of Blood Test Due to Failure to Establish that Result was Obtained within Three Hours of Operation of a Motor Vehicle;  filed by Atty. May Lee.  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 09-22-2022:  set for hearing Motion Hearing - length of hearing at the agreement of the parties.

8:34 AM - Case not called on the Record.
Attorney Kristi Brooks in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney May Y Lee appeared by video for Don P Mojica for cases 22CF822 and 22TR3001.
Attorney Andrew Herbers in court on case 22CM500 for Don P Mojica.
Defendant Don P Mojica in court, in custody. 
Attorney Lee will be filing motions by next week.
Court sets a check case and when the motion are filed then they will be scheduled.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witnesses A-C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

8:53 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defendant Don Patrick Mojica in court, in custody.  Attorney May Y Lee appeared by video for Don Patrick Mojica on cases 22TR3001 and 22CF822.   Atty Herbers appears for defendant on case 22CM500.
Atty Lee filed a bail motion in this matter. 
Atty Lee requests a bail modification in this matter. 
State objects to any bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
Atty Lee makes a further statement to the court. 
Court modifies bail to $15,000 cash, all conditions remain the same on case 22CF822.

records.addlTxt:
Search Warrant Executed on 05-24-2022 - 2015 Ford Transit Van (White)
Endorsement on Warrant
Return of Officer
Affidavit
Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Amended Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.

08:19 AM Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Don Patrick Mojica in court, in custody, with attorney May Y Lee.   

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.
Detective Charlene Craft sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Brejcha.
Cross examination by Attorney Lee.  
Court notes an error within the complaint that there is a Witness D in the complaint but the Victim identification key references only a Witness C.
Attorney Brejcha states they will file an additional amended complaint notating Witness C as there is not a Witness D.
Court proceeds with the hearing notating the person identified in the complaint is actually Witness C within the victim identification key.
Exhibit 1 marked, offered and received.    
State rests and moves for bind over without argument.
Defense presents closing arguments moves for dismissal.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.
Court will remove 22CM500 from the pretrial calendar and tag along with this case for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
